Firstly, the higher dimensionality challenge is tackled by using a stack-based ensemble learning approach. This approach combines multiple base classifiers to create a strong classifier that can handle the complex and high-dimensional nature of multi-spectral image data. By leveraging the diversity of the base classifiers, the ensemble learning approach can effectively capture the different aspects of the data and improve the classification accuracy.

Secondly, the Hughes phenomenon, which refers to the loss of classification accuracy due to the increase in the number of spectral bands, is addressed by integrating the proposed ensemble learning with the XGBoost method. XGBoost is a powerful machine learning algorithm that can handle high-dimensional data and mitigate the Hughes phenomenon.
